intro: Rourea platysepala, commonly known as the flat-lobed rourea, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, often surrounded by specialized bracts. Its leaves are typically ovate to elliptical in shape and may have a slightly hairy surface. Rourea platysepala is often found in moist, shaded habitats within tropical forests.
